title: Western Province hit hardest by Chikungunya surge
byline: The Western Province has recorded the highest number of Chikungunya cases in the country this year, according to official data released by health authorities.

title: Kandy brimmed with crowd, filled with litter
byline: The cascade of unexpectedly large crowds in view of the Dalada exposition (The exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic of The Buddha) has rendered the Kandy city administrative authorities handicapped, eventually prompting them to limit public arrivals.

title: Senior citizens no longer required to visit IRD for TIN registration
byline: In a move aimed at easing the administrative burden on senior citizens and persons with disabilities, the Inland Revenue Department (IRD) yesterday said it has introduced a more accessible procedure for

title: China tells Trump: If you want trade talks, cancel tariffs
byline: China has called on the US to cancel its sweeping tariffs on Chinese goods entering the country as a sign that the President Donald Trump is serious about resolving the trade war between the two countries.

title: FitsAir launches Business Class
byline: FitsAir, Sri Lanka’s first privately owned international airline and a leading low-cost carrier, yesterday announced the launch of Business Class across its regional network, which will be effective from today

title: Port of Colombo sees transshipment volumes dip in 1Q
byline: Transshipment volumes at the Port of Colombo experienced a decline in the first quarter of 2025 compared to the same period last year.

title: Foreign Minister to attend Pope Francis’ funeral mass
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath will represent the Government of Sri Lanka at His Holiness Pope Francis’ funeral, which will be held on Saturday (April 26) in Saint Peter’s Square, Vatican City.

title: Triple murder suspect repatriated from India
byline: A suspect wanted in connection with the triple murder in Middeniya has been arrested in India and repatriated to Sri Lanka this morning.

title: President makes surprise visit to Kandy
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake made an unannounced visit to Kandy on last evening to inspect the situation following reports of four deaths during the special exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic and the unexpected influx of devotees.

title: Coroner, his assistant granted bail over accepting bribe
byline: The Anuradhapura Municipal Coroner and his assistant were released on bail today over the allegations of accepting a bribe of Rs. 2,000 for issuing a postmortem report.

title: Two Sri Lankan Opposition MPs arrive in Vatican to attend Pope’s funeral
byline: Two Sri Lankan Opposition Members of Parliament, Dr. Kavinda Jayawardene and Hector Appuhamy have also travelled to the Vatican to attend the funeral of late Pope Francis.

title: SriLankan Airlines CEO Richard Nuttall named as next president of Philippine Airlines
byline: Philippine Airlines (PAL) has named Richard Nuttall, the current CEO of SriLankan Airlines, as its new President, effective May 29, 2025.

title: 28 injured in Mahiyangana school bus accident
byline: A total of 28 people were injured when a bus carrying school children met with an accident at the Mahiyangana-Tissapura PTS junction this morning, police said.

title: India’s hostile actions denounced across political spectrum
byline: As Pakistan and India teeter on the brink of another clash, political parties from across the spectrum denounced the series of hostile measures, including the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, announced by New Delhi in the aftermath of the Pahalgam attack.

title: SL, USA to reach bilateral trade agreement: PMD
byline: Sri Lanka and the United States agreed to continue the discussions on reciprocal tariff with the objective of finalising a bilateral trade agreement between the two countries,the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Cop scolds soldier in Kandy: IGP calls for action
byline: The Acting Inspector General of Police has ordered an investigation into a video circulating on social media showing a police officer scolding a soldier near a queue at the ongoing exposition of the Sacred  Tooth Relic in Kandy.

title: Suspect arrested for producing child sexual abuse material
byline: The Police Children & Women’s Bureau has arrested a 34-year-old suspect for obtaining child pornography via social media and producing explicit material involving a Sri Lankan boy.

title: China accuses US of ’misleading the public’ about trade talks
byline: China’s foreign ministry urged Washington on Friday to stop ’’misleading the public’’ on bilateral tariff negotiations, and said it wasn’t familiar with reports on whether Beijing was planning to exempt tariffs on some U.S. imports.

title: Severe lightning warning issued for 18 districts
byline: A severe lightning warning has been issued for 18 districts, valid for 11 pm today, the Meteorology Department said.

title: Schoolboy entering Dalada Maligawa as Buddhist monk arrested
byline: A schoolboy who attempted to enter the Sri Dalada Maligawa, clad as a Buddhist monk was arrested by the police.

title: UN urges India and Pakistan to show ‘maximum restraint’ following Kashmir attack
byline: The United Nations on Thursday appealed to both India and Pakistan to show “maximum restraint” and avoid any further “deterioration” following a deadly attack on tourists in Kashmir. The two countries have inched closer to war since the attack, downgrading diplomatic ties, closing border crossings and revoking visas.

title: PM requests devotees to be mindful, responsible, stay alert at Siri Dalada Vandanawa
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya requested devotees attending the Siri Dalada Vandanawa to be careful and act responsibly. She reminded them to be mindful of their surroundings and of the people next to them in the queue.

title: 28 injured in Mahiyangana bus accident
byline: A total of 28 people including 10 school children were injured when a bus met with an accident at the Mahiyangana-Tissapura PTS junction this morning, police said.

title: Court directs AG to file contempt charges against Deshabandu
byline: Matara Magistrate Aruna Indrajith Buddhadasa today directed the Attorney General to initiate proceedings before the Court of Appeal against former IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon, who is accused of contempt of court for allegedly violating conditions imposed upon his release on bail.

title: President Dissanayake condoles with PM Modi over Pahalgam terror attack
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has strongly condemned the recent terrorist attack in Pahalgam, India, which claimed the lives of several tourists.

title: AG nominates two officials to assist committee probing Deshabandu
byline: The Attorney General has nominated Additional Solicitor General (President’s Counsel) Dileepa Peiris and Deputy Solicitor General Rajitha Perera to assist the Committee of Inquiry investigating Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandhu Tennakoon.

title: EU GSP+ monitoring mission to visit Sri Lanka
byline: A high-level European Union GSP+ Monitoring Mission is scheduled to visit Sri Lanka from April 28 to May 7, 2025.

title: CSE surges past 15,700 mark amid broad-based gains
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) concluded today’s session on a strong note, with the All Share Price Index (ASPI) breaching the 15,700 level.
